metadata.name: stg_apple_store__app_crash_daily
metadata.comment: Provides daily data on app crashes, helping you understand app stability across different versions and devices.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

_fivetran_id.name: _fivetran_id
_fivetran_id.comment: A Fivetran-generated key that is unique for each record, for each app and date or for each vendor, depending on the table.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

app_version.name: app_version
app_version.comment: The app version of the app that the user is engaging with.

device.name: device
device.comment: Device type associated with the respective metric(s).

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment: A null field for crash data, but created to assist with joins downstream.

platform_version.name: platform_version
platform_version.comment: The platform version of the device engaging with your app.

crashes.name: crashes
crashes.comment: The number of recorded crashes experienced (User Opt-In only); a value of 0 indicates there were 0 crash reports or no value from the source report that day.

unique_devices.name: unique_devices
unique_devices.comment: The number of unique devices on which events were generated, based on users who have agreed to share their data with Apple and developers.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: stg_apple_store__app_session_daily
metadata.comment: Provides standard daily metrics on user sessions within your app, including session duration and device information.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

_fivetran_id.name: _fivetran_id
_fivetran_id.comment: A Fivetran-generated key that is unique for each record, for each app and date or for each vendor, depending on the table.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

app_version.name: app_version
app_version.comment: The app version of the app that the user is engaging with.

device.name: device
device.comment: Device type associated with the respective metric(s).

platform_version.name: platform_version
platform_version.comment: The platform version of the device engaging with your app.

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment: Where the user discovered the app, for example: App Store Browse, App Store Search, App Referrers, Web Referrers, App Clips, Unavailable,and Null. Null is the default value for data that does not provide source types, including: crashes, subscription events and subscription summary.

page_type.name: page_type
page_type.comment: The page type which led the user to discover your app.

app_download_date.name: app_download_date
app_download_date.comment: Date when the app was downloaded on the user's device.

territory.name: territory
territory.comment: The territory's (aka country) two-character ISO country code associated with the report's respective metric(s).

sessions.name: sessions
sessions.comment: The number of sessions. Based on users who have agreed to share their data with Apple and developers.

total_session_duration.name: total_session_duration
total_session_duration.comment: The total amount of time, in seconds, that users spent in sessions with your app on a given day.

unique_devices.name: unique_devices
unique_devices.comment: The number of unique devices on which events were generated, based on users who have agreed to share their data with Apple and developers.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.comment: Contains daily metrics on how users discover and engage with your app on the App Store.

_fivetran_id.name: _fivetran_id
_fivetran_id.comment: A Fivetran-generated key that is unique for each record, for each app and date or for each vendor, depending on the table.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

event.name: event
event.comment: The type of usage event that occurred.

page_type.name: page_type
page_type.comment: The page type which led the user to discover your app.

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment: Where the user discovered the app, for example: App Store Browse, App Store Search, App Referrers, Web Referrers, App Clips, Unavailable,and Null. Null is the default value for data that does not provide source types, including: crashes, subscription events and subscription summary.

engagement_type.name: engagement_type
engagement_type.comment: The type of user engagement action (e.g., Tap, Scroll).

device.name: device
device.comment: Device type associated with the respective metric(s).

platform_version.name: platform_version

territory.name: territory

counts.name: counts

unique_counts.name: unique_counts

metadata.name: stg_apple_store__app_store_download_daily
metadata.comment: Contains standard daily metrics on app downloads, including download types and sources.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

_fivetran_id.name: _fivetran_id
_fivetran_id.comment: A Fivetran-generated key that is unique for each record, for each app and date or for each vendor, depending on the table.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

download_type.name: download_type
download_type.comment:
The type of download event that occurred. Possible values include:
- **First-Time Download**: The user downloaded the app for the first time.
- **Redownload**: The user reinstalled the app after having downloaded it previously.
- **Auto-Download**: The app was automatically downloaded on another device using the same Apple ID.
- **Manual Update**: The user manually updated the app from the App Store.
- **Restore**: The app was restored from a backup.
- **Unavailable**: The download type is unknown or not reported.

app_version.name: app_version
app_version.comment: The app version of the app that the user is engaging with.

device.name: device
device.comment: Device type associated with the respective metric(s).

platform_version.name: platform_version
platform_version.comment: The platform version of the device engaging with your app.

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment: Where the user discovered the app, for example: App Store Browse, App Store Search, App Referrers, Web Referrers, App Clips, Unavailable,and Null. Null is the default value for data that does not provide source types, including: crashes, subscription events and subscription summary.

page_type.name: page_type
page_type.comment: The page type which led the user to discover your app.

pre_order.name: pre_order
pre_order.comment: Indicates whether the download was a result of a pre-order. If `true`, the user had pre-ordered the app before its release and it was automatically downloaded upon availability.

territory.name: territory
territory.comment: The territory's (aka country) two-character ISO country code associated with the report's respective metric(s).

counts.name: counts
counts.comment: The total count of events, based on users who have agreed to share their data with Apple and developers.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: stg_apple_store__app_store_installation_and_deletion_daily
metadata.comment: Contains standard daily metrics on app installations and deletions, providing insights into user acquisition and retention.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

_fivetran_id.name: _fivetran_id
_fivetran_id.comment: A Fivetran-generated key that is unique for each record, for each app and date or for each vendor, depending on the table.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

event.name: event
event.comment: The type of usage event that occurred.

download_type.name: download_type
download_type.comment:
The type of download event that occurred. Possible values include:
- **First-Time Download**: The user downloaded the app for the first time.
- **Redownload**: The user reinstalled the app after having downloaded it previously.
- **Auto-Download**: The app was automatically downloaded on another device using the same Apple ID.
- **Manual Update**: The user manually updated the app from the App Store.
- **Restore**: The app was restored from a backup.
- **Unavailable**: The download type is unknown or not reported.

app_version.name: app_version
app_version.comment: The app version of the app that the user is engaging with.

device.name: device
device.comment: Device type associated with the respective metric(s).

platform_version.name: platform_version
platform_version.comment: The platform version of the device engaging with your app.

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment: Where the user discovered the app, for example: App Store Browse, App Store Search, App Referrers, Web Referrers, App Clips, Unavailable,and Null. Null is the default value for data that does not provide source types, including: crashes, subscription events and subscription summary.

page_type.name: page_type
page_type.comment: The page type which led the user to discover your app.

app_download_date.name: app_download_date
app_download_date.comment: The date when the user originally downloaded the app on their device.

territory.name: territory
territory.comment: The territory's (aka country) two-character ISO country code associated with the report's respective metric(s).

counts.name: counts
counts.comment: The total count of events, based on users who have agreed to share their data with Apple and developers.

unique_devices.name: unique_devices
unique_devices.comment: The number of unique devices on which events were generated, based on users who have agreed to share their data with Apple and developers.

metadata.name: stg_apple_store__sales_subscription_events
metadata.comment: Daily subscription event report by account ID, app name, subscription name, event, country, state and device; this model is aggregated by date, app_name, account_id, country, state and subscription_name for easier transformations in the modeling package.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

_fivetran_id.name: _fivetran_id
_fivetran_id.comment: A Fivetran-generated key that is unique for each record, for each app and date or for each vendor, depending on the table.

vendor_number.name: vendor_number
vendor_number.comment: The vendor number associated with the subscription event or summary.

app_apple_id.name: app_apple_id
app_apple_id.comment: Apple ID of your subscription’s parent app.

event.name: event
event.comment: The type of usage event that occurred.

subscription_name.name: subscription_name
subscription_name.comment: The subscription name associated with the subscription event metric or subscription summary metric.

subscription_apple_id.name: subscription_apple_id
subscription_apple_id.comment: Apple ID of your subscription’s parent app.

subscription_group_id.name: subscription_group_id
subscription_group_id.comment: The group ID of the subscription.

standard_subscription_duration.name: standard_subscription_duration
standard_subscription_duration.comment: The duration of the standard subscription (e.g., 1 Month, 1 Year).

subscription_offer_type.name: subscription_offer_type
subscription_offer_type.comment: The type of subscription offer (e.g., Free Trial, Introductory Offer).

subscription_offer_duration.name: subscription_offer_duration
subscription_offer_duration.comment: The duration of the subscription offer (e.g., 7 Days).

marketing_opt_in.name: marketing_opt_in
marketing_opt_in.comment: If the subscription included a marketing opt-in, this field equals “Yes”. Otherwise, it is blank.

marketing_opt_in_duration.name: marketing_opt_in_duration
marketing_opt_in_duration.comment: Duration of the opt-in if applicable (e.g., 7 Days, 1 Month, 2 Months, 3 Months, 6 Months, or 1 Year).

preserved_pricing.name: preserved_pricing
preserved_pricing.comment: For Renew events, if the price is preserved, this field equals “Yes”. Otherwise, it is blank.

proceeds_reason.name: proceeds_reason
proceeds_reason.comment: For Renew events, if the subscription has been active for more than a year then you receive 85% of the customer price, minus applicable taxes, and this field equals “Rate After One Year”. Otherwise, you receive 70% and the field is blank.

promotional_offer_name.name: promotional_offer_name
promotional_offer_name.comment: The name of the promotional offer.

promotional_offer_id.name: promotional_offer_id
promotional_offer_id.comment: The ID of the promotional offer.

consecutive_paid_periods.name: consecutive_paid_periods
consecutive_paid_periods.comment: The total number of paid periods that the subscription has been active without cancellation. This does not include free trials, marketing opt-in bonus periods, or grace periods.

original_start_date.name: original_start_date
original_start_date.comment: The original start date of the subscription.

device.name: device
device.comment: Device type associated with the respective metric(s).

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment: A null field for this subscription data, but created to assist with joins downstream.

client.name: client
client.comment: The client associated with the subscription.

state.name: state
state.comment: The state associated with the subscription event metrics or subscription summary metrics.

country.name: country
country.comment: The country associated with the subscription event metrics and subscription summary metric(s). This country code maps to ISO-3166 Alpha-2.

previous_subscription_name.name: previous_subscription_name
previous_subscription_name.comment: The name of the previous subscription.

previous_subscription_apple_id.name: previous_subscription_apple_id
previous_subscription_apple_id.comment: The Apple ID of the previous subscription.

days_before_canceling.name: days_before_canceling
days_before_canceling.comment: For cancel events, the number of days from the start date to when a subscriber canceled, which could be in the middle of the period. This only applies to cancel events where cancellation reason equals ‘canceled.' Otherwise, it is blank.

cancellation_reason.name: cancellation_reason
cancellation_reason.comment: Reason for a cancellation (e.g., Billing issue, Price increase, Canceled, Removed from Sale, or Other.)

days_canceled.name: days_canceled
days_canceled.comment: For reactivate events, the number of days ago that the subscriber canceled.

quantity.name: quantity
quantity.comment: Number of events with the same values for the other fields.

paid_service_days_recovered.name: paid_service_days_recovered
paid_service_days_recovered.comment: The estimated number of paid service days recovered due to Billing Grace Period.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: stg_apple_store__sales_subscription_summary
metadata.comment: Daily subscription summary report by account ID, app name, country, state and subscription name; this model is aggregated by date, app_name, account_id, country, state and subscription_name for easier transformations in the modeling package.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

_fivetran_id.name: _fivetran_id
_fivetran_id.comment: A Fivetran-generated key that is unique for each record, for each app and date or for each vendor, depending on the table.

vendor_number.name: vendor_number
vendor_number.comment: The vendor number associated with the subscription event or summary.

app_apple_id.name: app_apple_id
app_apple_id.comment: Apple ID of your subscription’s parent app.

subscription_name.name: subscription_name
subscription_name.comment: The subscription name associated with the subscription event metric or subscription summary metric.

subscription_apple_id.name: subscription_apple_id
subscription_apple_id.comment: Apple ID of your subscription’s parent app.

subscription_group_id.name: subscription_group_id
subscription_group_id.comment: The group ID of the subscription.

standard_subscription_duration.name: standard_subscription_duration
standard_subscription_duration.comment: The duration of the standard subscription (e.g., 1 Month, 1 Year).

customer_price.name: customer_price
customer_price.comment: The price paid by the customer.

customer_currency.name: customer_currency
customer_currency.comment: Three-character ISO code indicating the customer’s currency.

developer_proceeds.name: developer_proceeds
developer_proceeds.comment: The proceeds for each item delivered.

proceeds_currency.name: proceeds_currency
proceeds_currency.comment: The currency of the developer proceeds.

preserved_pricing.name: preserved_pricing
preserved_pricing.comment: For Renew events, if the price is preserved, this field equals “Yes”. Otherwise, it is blank.

proceeds_reason.name: proceeds_reason
proceeds_reason.comment: For Renew events, if the subscription has been active for more than a year then you receive 85% of the customer price, minus applicable taxes, and this field equals “Rate After One Year”. Otherwise, you receive 70% and the field is blank.

subscription_offer_name.name: subscription_offer_name
subscription_offer_name.comment: The name of the subscription offer.

promotional_offer_id.name: promotional_offer_id
promotional_offer_id.comment: The ID of the promotional offer.

state.name: state
state.comment: The state associated with the subscription event metrics or subscription summary metrics.

country.name: country
country.comment: The country associated with the subscription event metrics and subscription summary metric(s). This country code maps to ISO-3166 Alpha-2.

device.name: device
device.comment: Device type associated with the respective metric(s).

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment: A null field for this subscription data, but created to assist with joins downstream.

client.name: client
client.comment: The client associated with the subscription.

active_standard_price_subscriptions.name: active_standard_price_subscriptions
active_standard_price_subscriptions.comment:
Total number of auto-renewable standard paid subscriptions currently active, excluding free trials, 
subscription offers, introductory offers, and marketing opt-ins. Subscriptions are active during the period for which the customer has paid without cancellation.

active_free_trial_introductory_offer_sub.name: active_free_trial_introductory_offer_subscriptions
active_free_trial_introductory_offer_sub.comment: Total number of introductory offer subscriptions currently in a free trial.

active_pay_up_front_introductory_offer_s.name: active_pay_up_front_introductory_offer_subscriptions
active_pay_up_front_introductory_offer_s.comment: Total number of introductory offer subscriptions currently with a pay up front introductory price.

active_pay_as_you_go_introductory_offer_.name: active_pay_as_you_go_introductory_offer_subscriptions
active_pay_as_you_go_introductory_offer_.comment: Total number of introductory offer subscriptions currently with a pay as you go introductory price.

free_trial_promotional_offer_subscriptio.name: free_trial_promotional_offer_subscriptions
free_trial_promotional_offer_subscriptio.comment: The number of free trial promotional offer subscriptions.

pay_up_front_promotional_offer_subscript.name: pay_up_front_promotional_offer_subscriptions
pay_up_front_promotional_offer_subscript.comment: The number of pay-up-front promotional offer subscriptions.

pay_as_you_go_promotional_offer_subscrip.name: pay_as_you_go_promotional_offer_subscriptions
pay_as_you_go_promotional_offer_subscrip.comment: The number of pay-as-you-go promotional offer subscriptions.

free_trial_offer_code_subscriptions.name: free_trial_offer_code_subscriptions
free_trial_offer_code_subscriptions.comment: The number of free trial offer code subscriptions.

pay_up_front_offer_code_subscriptions.name: pay_up_front_offer_code_subscriptions
pay_up_front_offer_code_subscriptions.comment: The number of pay-up-front offer code subscriptions.

pay_as_you_go_offer_code_subscriptions.name: pay_as_you_go_offer_code_subscriptions
pay_as_you_go_offer_code_subscriptions.comment: The number of pay-as-you-go offer code subscriptions.
